a.g: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال كعب: خلق الله تعالى آدم عليه السلام بيده وكتب التوراة بيده وغرس الجنة بيده ثم قال لها تكلمى فقالت: ﴿ قد أفلح المؤمنون ﴾ فهذه صفات الجنة ذكرناها جملة ثم نقلناها تفصيلا وقد ذكر الحسن البصري رحمه الله جملتها فقال: إن رمانها مثل الدلاء وإن أنهارها لمن ماء غير آسن وأنهار من لبن لم يتغير طعمه وأنهار من عسل مصفى لم يصفه الرجال وأنها من خمر لذة للشاربين لا تسفه الأحلام ولا تصدع منها الرءوس وإن فيها ما لا عين رأت ولا أذن سمعت ولا خطر على قلب بشر ملوك ناعمون أبناء ثلاث وثلاثون فى سن واحد طولهم ستون ذراعا فى السماء كحل جرد مرد قد أمنوا العذاب واطمأنت بهم الدار وإن أنهارها لتجرى على رضراض من ياقوت وزبرجد وإن عروقها ونخلها وكرمها اللؤلؤ وثمارها لا يعلم علمها إلا الله تعالى وإن ريحها ليوجد من مسيرة خمسمائة سنة وإن لهم فيها خيلا وإبلا هفافة رحالها وأزمتها وسروجها من ياقوت يتزاورون فيها وأزواجهم الحور العين كأنهن بيض مكنون وإن المرأة لتأخذ بين أصبعيها سبعين حلة فتلبسها فيرى مخ ساقها من وراء تلك السبعين حلة قد طهر الله الأخلاق من السوء والأجساد من الموت لا يمتخطون فيها ولا يبولون ولا يتغوطون وإنما هو حبشاء ورشح مسك لهم رزقهم فيها بكرة وعشيا أما إنه ليس ليل يكر الغدو على الرواح والرواح على الغدو وإن آخر من يدخل الجنة وأدناهم منزلة ليمد له فى بصره وملكه
Indeed, I have created Adam, peace be upon him, with My Hand [yad], and I wrote the Torah with My Hand, and I planted Paradise [al-jannah] with My Hand. Then I said to it, 'Speak,' and it said: **"Indeed, the believers have attained success [qad aflaha al-mu'minun]."** These are the attributes [sifat] of Paradise which We have mentioned in summary, then We have conveyed them in detail. And indeed, Al-Hasan Al-Basri, may God have mercy upon him, mentioned them all, saying: Indeed, its pomegranates are like water-skins, and indeed its rivers are of water [ma'] that is not stagnant, and rivers of milk [laban] whose taste has not changed, and rivers of honey [asal] purified, not purified by men. And indeed, in it is wine [khamr], a delight for the drinkers, which does not befuddle the minds nor cause headaches. And indeed, in it is what no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and what has not occurred to the heart [qalb] of any human. They are kings, living in comfort, sons of thirty-three, in one age. Their height is sixty cubits in the sky, with kohl, beardless, smooth-skinned. They are secure from the punishment, and the Abode [al-dar] is at peace with them. And indeed, its rivers flow over pebbles of ruby and chrysolite. And indeed, its roots, its palm trees, and its vines are of pearl, and its fruits—none knows their knowledge [ilm] except God, the Exalted. And indeed, its fragrance is found from a distance of five hundred years' journey. And indeed, for them in it are horses and camels, swift, their saddles and bridles and saddles of ruby. They visit one another in it, and their spouses are the wide-eyed maidens [al-hur al-'in], as if they were hidden pearls. And indeed, a woman takes seventy garments between her two fingers and wears them, and the marrow of her shin is seen from behind those seventy garments. God has purified the characters [al-akhlaq] from evil and the bodies from death. They do not blow their noses in it, nor do they urinate, nor do they defecate. It is only a belch and a sweat of musk. Their provision [rizq] is in it morning and evening. Behold, there is no night; morning comes upon evening and evening comes upon morning. And indeed, the last to enter Paradise [al-jannah] and the lowest in rank, sight [basar] and dominion [mulk] will be extended for him.

a.g: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive
And they who turn away from ill speech
And they who are observant of zakah
And they who guard their private parts
Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed -
But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -
And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive
And they who carefully maintain their prayers -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم ختم أوصاف المفلحين بالصلاة أيضا فقال تعالى: ﴿ والذين هم على صلواتهم يحافظون ﴾ وأما صلاة الغافلين فهي مخطرة إلا أن يتغمده الله برحمته والرحمة واسعة والكرم فائض فنسأل الله أن يتغمدنا برحمته ويغمرنا بمغفرته إذ لا وسيلة لنا إلا الاعتراف بالعجز عن القيام بطاعته. واعلم أن تخليص الصلاة عن الآفات وإخلاصها لوجه الله عز وجل وأداءها بالشروط الباطنة التي ذكرناها من الخشوع والتعظيم والحياء سبب لحصول أنوار في القلب تكون تلك الأنوار مفاتيح علوم المكاشفة فأولياء الله المكاشفون بملكوت السموات والأرض وأسرار الربوبية إنما يكاشفون في الصلاة لا سيما في السجود إذ يتقرب العبد من ربه عز وجل بالسجود ولذلك قال تعالى: ﴿ واسجد واقترب ﴾ {} وإنما تكون مكاشفة كل مصلّ على قدر صفائه عن كدورات الدنيا ويختلف ذلك بالقوة والضعف والقلة والكثرة وبالجلاء والخفاء حتى ينكشف لبعضهم الشيء بعينه وينكشف لبعضهم الشيء بمثاله كما كشف لبعضهم الدنيا في صورة جيفة والشيطان في صورة كلب جاثم عليها يدعو إليها ويختلف أيضا بما فيه المكاشفة فبعضهم ينكشف له من صفات الله تعالى وجلاله ولبعضهم من أفعاله ولبعضهم من دقائق علوم المعاملة ويكون لتعين تلك المعاني في كل وقت أسباب خفية لا تحصى وأشدها مناسبة الهمة فإنها إذا كانت مصروفة إلى شيء معين كان ذلك أولى بالانكشاف ولما كانت هذه الأمور لا تتراءى إلا في المرائي الصقيلة وكانت المرآة كلها صدئة فاحتجبت عنها الهداية لا لبخل من جهة المنعم بالهداية بل لخبث متراكم الصدأ على مصب الهداية تسارعت الألسنة إلى إنكار مثل ذلك إذ الطبع مجبول على إنكار غير الحاضر ولو كان للجنين عقل لأنكر إمكان وجود الإنسان في متسع الهواء ولو كان للطفل تمييز ما ربما أنكر ما يزعم العقلاء إدراكه من ملكوت السموات والأرض وهكذا الإنسان في كل طور يكاد ينكر ما
Indeed, then He concluded the attributes of the successful ones with prayer as well, saying, the Most High: **"And those who are over their prayers [salawat] vigilant [yuhafidhun]."** As for the prayer of the heedless, it is a peril, unless Allah envelops them with His mercy [rahma], and the mercy is vast, and the generosity is overflowing. So we ask Allah to envelop us with His mercy and to immerse us with His forgiveness, for we have no means except the confession of incapacity to fulfill obedience to Him. And know that purifying the prayer [salah] from defects, and making it sincere [ikhlas] for the Countenance of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, and performing it with the inward conditions we mentioned—of humility [khushu'], reverence [ta'zim], and shame [haya']—is a cause for the occurrence of lights [anwar] in the heart [qalb]. Those lights become keys to the sciences of unveiling [mukashafa]. The allies of Allah [awliya'], those unveiled to the dominion [malakut] of the heavens and the earth and the secrets of Lordship, are only unveiled during prayer, especially in prostration [sujud], for the servant draws near to his Lord, the Mighty and Majestic, through prostration. And for that reason, Allah, the Most High, said: **"And prostrate and draw near."** And the unveiling [mukashafa] for every person praying is only according to the measure of his clarity from the impurities of the world [dunya], and that differs in strength and weakness, in scarcity and abundance, and in clarity and obscurity—until the thing itself is unveiled to some of them, and to some of them the thing is unveiled by its likeness, just as the world [dunya] was unveiled to some of them in the form of a carcass, and Satan in the form of a dog crouching upon it, calling to it. And it also differs according to what is in the unveiling: for some of them, His attributes [sifat] and His majesty [jalal] are unveiled; for some, His actions; and for some, the subtleties of the sciences of spiritual transaction [mu'amala]. And the specification of those meanings in every moment has hidden causes beyond enumeration. The most fitting of them is aspiration [himma], for when it is directed to a specific thing, that thing is most deserving of being unveiled. And since these matters only appear in polished mirrors, and all mirrors were rusty, guidance [hidaya] was veiled from them—not due to stinginess from the side of the Bestower of guidance, but due to the foulness of accumulated rust upon the place where guidance is received. Tongues hastened to deny such things, for nature is created to deny what is not present. If the fetus had intellect, it would deny the possibility of a human existing in the expanse of the air. And if the child had discernment, he might perhaps deny what the people of intellect claim to perceive of the dominion [malakut] of the heavens and the earth. And thus is man in every stage; he almost denies what...

a.g: Those are the inheritors
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله عز وجل: ﴿ قد أفلح المؤمنون الذين هم في صلاتهم خاشعون ﴾ فمدحهم بعد الإيمان بصلاة مخصوصة وهي المقرونة بالخشوع ثم ختم أوصاف المفلحين بالصلاة أيضا فقال تعالى: ﴿ والذين هم على صلواتهم يحافظون ﴾ ثم قال تعالى في ثمرة تلك الصفات: ﴿ أولئك هم الوارثون الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خالدون ﴾ فوصفهم بالفلاح أوّلا وبوراثة الفردوس آخرا. فالمصلون هم ورثة الفردوس وهم المشاهدون لنور الله تعالى والمتمتعون بقربه ودنوه من قلوبهم.
Indeed, Allah the Almighty has said: "Indeed, the believers have succeeded [qad aflaha al-mu'minun] – those who are in their prayer humbly submissive [khashi'un]." So He praised them, after faith [iman], with a specific prayer [salah] – that which is coupled with humility [khushu']. Then He concluded the attributes of the successful ones [al-muflihun] with prayer [salah] as well, saying, the Exalted: "And those who are over their prayers protective [yuhafizun]." Then He said, the Exalted, regarding the fruit of those attributes: "Those are the inheritors [al-warithun] who will inherit Paradise [al-Firdaws]; they will abide therein eternally." So He described them with success [al-falah] first, and with inheriting Paradise [al-Firdaws] last. Thus, those who pray [al-musallun] are the inheritors of Paradise [warathat al-Firdaws], and they are the ones who witness the light [nur] of Allah the Exalted and who enjoy His proximity [qurb] and His nearness [dunuww] to their hearts [qulub].

a.g: Who will inherit al-Firdaus. They will abide therein eternally.
And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وذكر أنك مخلوق من نطفة قذرة فقال قتل الإنسان ما أكفره من أي شئ خلقه من نطفة خلقه فقدره ثم السبيل يسره ثم أماته فأقبره ثم إذا شاء أنشره وقال تعالى ومن آياته أن خلقكم من تراب ثم إذا أنتم بشر تنتشرون وقال تعالى ألم يك نطفة من منى يمنى ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى وقال تعالى ألم نخلقكم من ماء مهين فجعلناه في قرار مكين إلى قدر معلوم وقال أولم ير الإنسان أنا خلقناه من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين وقال إنا خلقنا الإنسان من نطفة أمشاج ثم ذكر كيف جعل النطفة علقة والعلقة مضغة والمضغة عظاما فقال تعالى ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من سلالة من طين ثم جعلناه نطفة في قرار مكين ثم خلقنا النطفة علقة الآية فتكرير ذكر النطفة في الكتاب العزيز ليس ليسمع لفظه ويترك التفكر في معناه فانظر الآن إلى النطفة وهي قطرة من الماء قذرة لو تركت ساعة ليضربها الهواء فسدت وانتنت كيف أخرجها رب الأرباب من الصلب والترائب وكيف جمع بين الذكر والأنثى وألقى الألفة والمحبة في قلوبهم وكيف قادهم بسلسلة المحبة والشهوة الى الاجتماع وكيف استخرج النطفة من الرجل بحركة الوقاع وكيف استجلب دم الحيض من أعماق العروق وجمعه في الرحم ثم كيف خلق المولود من النطفة وسقاه بماء الحيض وغذاه حتى نما وربا وكبر وكيف جعل النطفة وهي بيضاء مشرقة علقة حمراء ثم كيف جعلها مضغة ثم كيف قسم أجزاء النطفة وهي متساوية متشابهة إلى العظام والأعصاب والعروق والأوتار واللحم ثم كيف ركب من اللحوم والأعصاب والعروق الأعضاء الظاهرة فدور الرأس وشق السمع والبصر والأنف والفم وسائر المنافذ ثم مد اليد والرجل وقسم رءوسها بالأصابع وقسم الأصابع بالأنامل ثم كيف ركب الأعضاء الباطنة من القلب والمعدة والكبد والطحال والرئة والرحم والمثانة والأمعاء كل واحد على شكل مخصوص ومقدار مخصوص لعمل مخصوص ثم كيف قسم كل عضو من هذه الأعضاء بأقسام أخر فركب العين من سبع طبقات لكل طبقة وصف مخصوص وهيئة مخصوصة لو فقدت طبقة منها أو زالت صفة من صفاتها تعطلت العين عن الإبصار فلو ذهبنا إلى أن نصف ما في آحاد هذه الأعضاء من العجائب والآيات لانقضي فيه الأعمار فانظر الآن إلى العظام وهي أجسام صلبة قوية كيف خلقها من نطفة سخيفة رقيقة ثم جعلها قواما للبدن وعمادا له ثم قدرها بمقادير مختلفة وأشكال مختلفة فمنه صغير وكبير وطويل ومستدير ومجوف ومصمت وعريض ودقيق ولما كان الإنسان محتاجا إلى الحركة بجملة بدنه وببعض أعضائه مفتقرا للتردد في حاجاته لم يجعل عظمه عظما واحدا بل عظاما كثيرة بينها مفاصل حتى تتيسر بها الحركة وقدر شكل كل واحدة منها على وفق الحركة المطلوبة بها ثم وصل مفاصلها وربط بعضها ببعض بأوتار أنبتها من أحد طرفي العظم وألصقه بالعطم الآخر
Indeed, We created the human being [al-insan] from an extract of clay [tin]. Then We placed him as a drop of sperm [nutfah] in a firm resting place [qararin makin]. Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot [alaqah], and We made the clot into a lump [mudghah], and We made the lump into bones [izam], and We clothed the bones with flesh [lahm]; then We brought him into being as another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators. (Quran 23:12-14) And He reminds you that you were created from a base fluid [nutfah qadhirah]. He said: "Destroyed is man; how ungrateful he is! From what thing did He create him? From a sperm-drop [nutfah] He created him and destined for him; then He made the way easy for him; then He causes him to die and be buried; then when He wills, He will resurrect him." (80:17-22) And He, the Exalted, said: "And among His signs is that He created you from dust [turab], then, at once, you are human beings dispersing [tansharun]." (30:20) And He, the Exalted, said: "Was he not a sperm-drop [nutfah] of semen emitted [mani yumna]? Then he was a clinging clot [alaqah], and He created [fakhalaqa] and proportioned [fasawwa]." (75:37-38) And He, the Exalted, said: "Did We not create you from a despised water [ma'in mahin]? Then We placed it in a firm resting place [qararin makin], for a known extent [qadar ma'lum]." (77:20-22) And He said: "Does man not consider that We created him from a sperm-drop [nutfah]? And at once he is a clear adversary [khasim mubin]." (36:77) And He said: "We created the human being from a sperm-drop mixed [nutfah amshaj]." (76:2) Then He mentioned how He made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot [alaqah], and the clot into a lump [mudghah], and the lump into bones [izam]. The repeated mention of the sperm-drop [nutfah] in the Mighty Book is not merely to hear its word and neglect reflection upon its meaning. So look now at the sperm-drop [nutfah]—it is a droplet of base, impure water. If it were left for an hour for the air to strike it, it would spoil and become foul. How did the Lord of lords extract it from the loins and ribs? How did He bring together the male and the female and cast affection [ulfah] and love [mahabbah] into their hearts [qulub]? How did He lead them by the chain of love [mahabbah] and desire [shahwah] to union? How did He extract the sperm-drop [nutfah] from the man by the movement of intercourse? How did He draw the menstrual blood from the depths of the veins and gather it in the womb? Then how did He create the child from the sperm-drop [nutfah] and nourish it with the water of menstruation until it grew, developed, and became large? And how did He make the sperm-drop [nutfah], which is white and shining, into a red clinging clot [alaqah]? Then how did He make it into a lump [mudghah]? Then how did He divide the parts of the sperm-drop [nutfah], which are equal and similar, into bones [izam], nerves [a'sab], veins [urouq], tendons [awtar], and flesh [lahm]? Then how did He construct from the flesh [luhum], nerves [a'sab], and veins [urouq] the apparent limbs [a'da']: the roundness of the head, the aperture for hearing, sight, the nose, the mouth, and all the other openings? Then He extended the hand and the leg and divided their ends into fingers [asabi'], and divided the fingers into fingertips [anamil]. Then how did He construct the internal organs [a'da']: the heart [qalb], the stomach [ma'idah], the liver [kabid], the spleen [tihal], the lung [ri'ah], the womb [rahim], the bladder [mathanah], and the intestines [am'a']—each one with a specific form [shakl makhsus] and a specific measure [miqdar makhsus] for a specific function [amal makhsus]? Then how did He divide each one of these organs into other divisions? He constructed the eye from seven layers [tabaqat]; for each layer is a specific attribute [wasf makhsus] and a specific form [hai'ah makhsus]. If a single layer from them were missing, or an attribute from its attributes were removed, the eye would be incapacitated from sight [ibsar]. If we were to begin describing the wonders [aja'ib] and signs [ayat] contained in each single one of these organs, lifetimes would be exhausted in it. So look now at the bones [izam]—they are solid, strong bodies. How did He create them from a weak, delicate sperm-drop [nutfah]? Then He made them the framework [qiwam] for the body and its support [amad]. Then He proportioned them with different measures [maqadir] and different forms [ashkal]: among them is small and large, long and round, hollow and solid, broad and delicate. And since the human being is in need of movement with his entire body and with some of his limbs [a'da'], and is in need of moving about for his needs, He did not make his bone a single bone, but rather many bones [izam] between which are joints [mafasil] so that movement is facilitated by them. And He proportioned the form [shakl] of each one in accordance with the movement required by it. Then He connected their joints and bound some of them to others with tendons [awtar] which He caused to grow from one end of the bone and attached it to the other bone.

a.g: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging.

Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.
Then indeed, after that you are to die.
Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.
And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.
And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.
And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.
And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food for those who eat.
And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
And upon them and on ships you are carried.
And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allah had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.
He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."
[Noah] said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."

So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation, and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows, put into the ship from each [creature] two mates and your family, except those for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.
And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allah who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'
And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].' "
Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].
Then We produced after them a generation of others.
And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.
And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
السبب الرابع: التعجب، كما أخبر الله تعالى عن الأمم السالفة إذ قالوا "ما أنتم إلا بشر مثلنا" "وقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا" "ولئن أطعتم بشراً مثلكم إنكم إذاً لخاسرون" فتعجبوا من أن يفوز برتبة الرسالة والوحي والقرب من الله تعالى بشر مثلهم فحسدوهم، وأحبوا زوال النبوة عنهم جزعاً أن يفضل عليهم من هو مثلهم في الخلقة، لا عن قصد تكبر وطلب رياسة وتقدم عداوة أو سبب آخر من سائر الأسباب،
Indeed, the fourth cause [sabab] is astonishment [ta'ajjub], just as God, the Exalted, has informed us concerning the nations of old when they said, "You are but human beings like us" [ma antum illa basharun mithluna], and "Shall we believe for two human beings like ourselves?" [wa qalu anu'minu libasharayni mithlina], and "If you obey a human being like yourselves, then indeed you would be losers" [wa la'in ata'tum basharan mithlakum innakum idhan lakhasirun]. So they were astonished that a human being like them should attain the rank [rutbah] of prophethood [risalah] and revelation [wahy] and closeness [qurb] to God, the Exalted. Thus they envied them, and they desired the removal of prophethood from them, out of distress that one who is like them in creation [khalqah] should be preferred over them—not from an intention of arrogance [takabbur] and seeking leadership [riyasah] and advancing enmity ['adawah], or from any other cause [sabab] among all the causes.

a.g: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?
How far, how far, is that which you are promised.
Life is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.
He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allah, and we will not believe him."
He said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."
[Allah] said, "After a little, they will surely become regretful."
So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.
Then We produced after them other generations.
No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].

Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority
To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.
They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
السبب الرابع: التعجب، كما أخبر الله تعالى عن الأمم السالفة إذ قالوا "ما أنتم إلا بشر مثلنا" "وقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا" "ولئن أطعتم بشراً مثلكم إنكم إذاً لخاسرون" فتعجبوا من أن يفوز برتبة الرسالة والوحي والقرب من الله تعالى بشر مثلهم فحسدوهم، وأحبوا زوال النبوة عنهم جزعاً أن يفضل عليهم من هو مثلهم في الخلقة، لا عن قصد تكبر وطلب رياسة وتقدم عداوة أو سبب آخر من سائر الأسباب.
Indeed, the fourth cause [sabab] is astonishment [ta'ajjub], just as God, the Exalted, informed of the past nations when they said, "You are but human beings like us" and "They said, 'Shall we believe for two human beings like ourselves?'" and "And if you obey a human being like yourselves, then indeed you would be losers." So they were astonished that a human being like them should attain the rank [rutbah] of prophethood [risalah] and revelation [wahy] and closeness [qurb] to God, the Exalted. Thus they envied them, and they desired the removal of prophethood from them, out of distress that one who is like them in creation should be favored over them—not from an intention of arrogance [takabbur] or a pursuit of leadership [riyasah] and precedence, nor from enmity or any other cause from among the various causes.

a.g: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.
And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.
And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.
[Allah said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى كلوا من الطيبات واعملوا صالحا أمر بالأكل من الطيبات قبل العمل وقيل إن المراد به الحلال.
Indeed, eat of the good things [al-tayyibat] and do righteous deeds [a'malu salihan]. The command to eat of the good things [al-tayyibat] precedes the command for action, and it is said that what is intended by it is the lawful [al-halal].

a.g: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me."
But the people divided their religion among them into sects - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.
So leave them in their confusion for a time.
Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأما معرفته بطريق التقليد والتصديق فهو أن يؤمن بكتاب الله تعالى ويصدق رسوله وقد قال تعالى "أيحسبون أن ما نمدهم به من مال وبنين نسارع لهم في الخيرات بل لا يشعرون" وقال تعالى "سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون" وقال تعالى "فتحنا عليهم أبواب كل شيء حتى إذا فرحوا بما أوتوا أخذناهم بغتة فإذا هم مبلسون" وفي تفسير قوله تعالى "سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون" أنهم كلما أحدثوا ذنباً أحدثنا لهم نعمة ليزيد غرورهم وقال تعالى "إنما نملي لهم ليزدادوا إثماً" وقال تعالى "ولا تحسبن الله غافلاً عما يعمل الظالمون إنما يؤخرهم ليوم تشخص فيه الأبصار" إلى غير ذلك مما ورد في كتاب الله تعالى وسنة رسوله، فمن آمن به تخلص من هذا الغرور فإن منشأ هذا الغرور والجهل بالله وبصفاته، فإن من عرفه لا يأمن مكره ولا يغتر بأمثال هذه الخيالات الفاسدة.
Indeed, as for knowing Him [Allah] by way of blind-following [taqlid] and affirmation [tasdiq], it is that one believes in the Book of Allah, the Exalted, and affirms His Messenger. And He, the Exalted, has said: "Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children, We are hastening for them in good things? Rather, they do not perceive [la yash'urūn]." (23:55-56) And He, the Exalted, has said: "We will gradually draw them [from destruction] from where they do not know." (7:182) And He, the Exalted, has said: "We opened to them the gates of every thing until, when they rejoiced in what they were given, We seized them suddenly, and at once they were in despair." (6:44) And in the interpretation of His saying, the Exalted: "We will gradually draw them [from destruction] from where they do not know," it is that whenever they commit a sin, We grant them a blessing [ni'mah] so that their delusion [ghurūr] increases. And He, the Exalted, has said: "We only grant them respite that they may increase in sin." (3:178) And He, the Exalted, has said: "And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror]." (14:42) And other than this from what has come in the Book of Allah, the Exalted, and the Sunnah of His Messenger. So whoever believes in this is freed from this delusion [ghurūr], for the source of this delusion [ghurūr] is ignorance [jahl] of Allah and His attributes. Indeed, whoever knows Him [Allah] does not feel secure from His plan [makr] nor is he deluded [yaghtarr] by these false imaginings [khayālāt].

a.g: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.
Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وبالجملة فمن جوز أن يكون عند الله شقياً وقد سبق القضاء في الأزل بشقوته فما له سبيل إلى أن يتكبر بحال من الأحوال. نعم إن غلب عليه الخوف رأى كل أحد خيراً من نفسه وذلك هو الفضيلة، كما روي أن عابداً أوى إلى جبل فقيل له في النوم: ائت فلاناً الإسكاف فسله أن يدعو لك. فأتاه فسأله عن عمله فأخبره أنه يصوم النهار، ويكتسب فيتصدق ويطعم عياله ببعضه، فرجع وهو يقول: إن هذا لحسن، ولكن ليس هذا كالتفرغ لطاعة الله فأتى في النوم ثانياً فقيل له: ائت فلاناً الإسكاف فقل له: ما هذا الصفار الذي بوجهك؟ فأتاه فسأله فقال له: ما رأيت أحداً من الناس إلا وقع لي: أنه سينجو وأهلك أنا، فقال العابد: بهذه. والذي يدل على فضيلة هذه الخصلة قوله تعالى "إن الذين هم من خشية ربهم مشفقون" فمتى زال الإشفاق والحذر مما سبق به القضاء في الأزل - وينكشف عند خاتمة الأجل - غلب الأمن من مكر الله وذلك يوجب الكبر وهو سبب الهلاك. فالكبر دليل الأمن والأمن مهلك. والتواضع دليل الخوف وهو مسعد؛ فإذن ما يفسده العابد بإضمار الكبر واحتقار الخلق والنظر إليهم بعين الاستصغار أكثر مما يصلحه بظاهر الأعمال.
Indeed, in summary, whoever considers it possible that he may be wretched [shaqiyy] with Allah, and that the decree [qada'] in pre-eternity [al-azal] has preceded concerning his wretchedness, has no way to be arrogant [yata-kabbar] in any state whatsoever. Yes, if fear [khawf] overcomes him, he sees everyone as better than himself, and that is the virtue [al-fadilah]. As it is narrated that an ascetic ['abid] took refuge in a mountain, and it was said to him in a dream: "Go to so-and-so the cobbler [al-iskaff] and ask him to supplicate for you." So he went to him and asked him about his practice ['amal], and he informed him that he fasts the day, earns a living, gives charity [yata-saddaq], and feeds his family with some of it. The ascetic returned saying: "This is indeed good, but it is not like being free for the worship of Allah." Then he came in a second dream and it was said to him: "Go to so-and-so the cobbler and say to him: 'What is this pallor [al-saffar] on your face?'" So he went to him and asked him. He said to him: "I have not seen anyone from the people except that it occurs to me: that he will be saved [yanju] and I will be destroyed [ahlak]." The ascetic said: "By this." And what indicates the virtue of this characteristic is His saying, the Most High: "Indeed, those who are apprehensive [mushfiqun] from fear [khashya] of their Lord..." So when the apprehension [al-ishfaq] and caution [al-hadhar] from what the decree [al-qada'] has preceded with in pre-eternity [al-azal] – and which is unveiled [yankashif] at the conclusion of the term [khatimat al-ajal] – is removed, then feeling secure [al-amn] from the plan of Allah overcomes, and that necessitates arrogance [al-kibr], and it is the cause of destruction [al-halak]. So arrogance [al-kibr] is the proof of feeling secure [al-amn], and feeling secure [al-amn] is destructive [muhlik]. And humility [al-tawadu'] is the proof of fear [al-khawf], and it is felicitous [musa'id]. Therefore, what the ascetic ['abid] corrupts by harboring arrogance [al-kibr] and despising the creation [ih-tiqar al-khalq] and looking at them with the eye of belittlement [al-istisghar] is more than what he rectifies by the outward deeds [al-a'mal].

a.g: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord
And they who do not associate anything with their Lord
And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الحسن يعملون ما عملوا من أعمال البر ويخافون أن لا ينجيهم ذلك من عذاب الله
Indeed, they perform what they perform of righteous deeds [a'mal al-birr], and they fear that this will not save them from the punishment of Allah.

a.g: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.
And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.
But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides disbelief which they are doing,
Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.
Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.
My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels
In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.
Then have they not reflected over the Qur'an, or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?
Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?
Or do they say, "In him is madness?" Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.
Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.
And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.
And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]
Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.
And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.
And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.
They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."
Say, [O Muhammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"
They will say, "To Allah." Say, "Then will you not remember?"
Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"
They will say, "[They belong] to Allah." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"
Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"
They will say, "[All belongs] to Allah." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"
Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.

Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe [concerning Him].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
كان النخعي إذا مر بمثل قوله عز وجل: ﴿ ما اتخذ الله من ولد وما كان معه من إله ﴾ يخفض صوته كالمستحيي عن أن يذكره بكل شيء لا يليق به.
Indeed, when Al-Nakha'i would pass by a verse like the saying of the Almighty, the Exalted: "God has not taken any son, nor is there any god alongside Him," he would lower his voice, as one ashamed to mention concerning Him anything that is not fitting for Him.

a.g: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].
Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,
My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
And indeed, We are able to show you what We have promised them.
Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومنها أنه إذا بلى بذي شر فينبغي أن يتحمله ويتقيه قال بعضهم خالص المؤمن مخالصة وخالق الفاجر مخالفة فإن الفاجر يرضى بالخلق الحسن في الظاهر وقال أبو الدرداء إنا لنبش في وجوه أقوام وإن قلوبنا لتلعنهم وهذا معنى المداراة وهي مع من يخاف شره قال الله تعالى ادفع بالتي هي أحسن السيئة قال ابن عباس في معنى قوله ويدرءون بالحسنة السيئة أي الفحش والأذى بالسلام والمداراة.
Indeed, among them is that if one is afflicted by a possessor of evil [dhi sharr], then it is necessary that he bear him and be wary of him. Some have said: "The sincere believer's dealing is sincere dealing [mukhalasah], and his conduct with the wicked is dissembling conduct [mukhalafah], for the wicked is pleased with good character [khuluq hasan] in outward appearance." And Abu al-Darda' said: "Indeed, we smile in the faces of a people while our hearts [qulub] curse them." And this is the meaning of prudent courtesy [al-mudara'ah], and it is with one whose evil [sharr] is feared. Allah, the Exalted, said: "Repel evil with that which is better." Ibn Abbas said regarding the meaning of His saying, "And they repel evil with good": meaning obscenity and harm with peace and prudent courtesy [al-mudara'ah].

a.g: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الثامن أن يقول في مبتدأ قراءته: أعوذ بالله السميع العليم من الشيطان الرجيم ﴿ رب أعوذ بك من همزات الشياطين وأعوذ بك رب أن يحضرون ﴾ {} وليقرأ قل أعوذ برب الناس وسورة الحمد لله
Indeed, the eighth [matter] is that he should say at the beginning of his recitation: "I seek refuge in Allah, the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, from the accursed Satan [shaytan]." "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the whisperings of the devils [shayatin], and I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me." And let him recite: "Say: I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind," and the chapter: "All praise is for Allah."

a.g: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me."
[For such is the state of the disbelievers], until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومن مات ولم يحج مع اليسار فأمره شديد عند الله تعالى قال عمر رضي الله عنه لقد هممت أن أكتب في الأمصار بضرب الجزية على من لم يحج ممن يستطيع إليه سبيلا وعن سعيد بن جبير وإبراهيم النخعي ومجاهد وطاوس لو علمت رجلا غنيا وجب عليه الحج ثم مات قبل أن يحج ما صليت عليه وبعضهم كان له جار موسر فمات ولم يحج فلم يصل عليه وكان ابن عباس يقول: من مات ولم يزك ولم يحج سأل الرجعة إلى الدنيا وقرأ قوله عز وجل: ﴿ رب ارجعون لعلي أعمل صالحا فيما تركت ﴾ {} قال: الحج.
Indeed, whoever dies and has not performed the pilgrimage [hajj] despite having the means [yusar], his affair is severe with God, the Exalted. Umar, may God be pleased with him, said: "I was determined to write to the provinces to impose the poll tax [jizya] upon those who are capable [yastati'] of making the journey and yet do not perform the pilgrimage." And from Sa'id ibn Jubayr, Ibrahim al-Nakha'i, Mujahid, and Tawus: "If I knew of a wealthy man upon whom the pilgrimage was obligatory [wajaba 'alayhi al-hajj] and then he died before performing it, I would not pray over him." And some of them had a wealthy neighbor who died without having performed the pilgrimage, so they did not pray over him. And Ibn Abbas used to say: "Whoever dies without having given the alms [zakat] and without having performed the pilgrimage will ask to be returned to the world [dunya]," and he recited His word, the Mighty and Majestic: {'My Lord, send me back, that I might do righteousness in what I left behind'} [23:99-100]. He said: "The pilgrimage [al-hajj]."

a.g: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فيقول الجبار: ﴿ كلا أنها كلمة هو قائلها ﴾ أي ليقولنها عند الموت.
Indeed, the All-Compelling [al-Jabbar] says: "No! It is but a word he is saying." That is, he will surely say it at the moment of death.

a.g: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الأصل الرابع: الميزان وهو حق قال الله تعالى: ﴿ ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة ﴾ { سورة الأنبيآء: 47 } وقال تعالى: ﴿ فمن ثقلت موازينه فأولئك هم المفلحون. ومن خفت موازينه ﴾ { سورة المؤمنون:102، 103 } ووجهها أن الله تعالى يحدث في صحائف الأعمال وزنا بحسب درجات الأعمال عند الله تعالى فتصير مقادير أعمال العباد معلومة للعباد حتى يظهر لهم العدل في العقاب أو الفضل في العفو وتضعيف الثواب.
Indeed, the Fourth Foundation: The Balance [al-Mizan], and it is the Truth [al-Haqq]. Allah, the Exalted, says: "And We place the scales of justice [al-Mawazin al-Qist] for the Day of Resurrection [Yawm al-Qiyamah]" (Surah Al-Anbiya: 47). And He, the Exalted, says: "So he whose scales are heavy [thaqqalat mawazinuhu]—then those are the successful [al-Muflihun]. And he whose scales are light [khaffat mawazinuhu]" (Surah Al-Mu'minun: 102-103). And its meaning [wajhuha] is that Allah, the Exalted, creates in the scrolls of deeds [suhuf al-a'mal] a weight [wazn] according to the degrees of deeds [darajat al-a'mal] with Allah, the Exalted, so the measures of the deeds of the servants [maqadir a'mal al-'ibad] become known to the servants, until justice [al-'adl] in punishment or grace [al-fadl] in pardon and the multiplication of reward [tad'if al-thawab] becomes manifest to them.

a.g: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.
The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد قال بعض العلماء فى قوله: ﴿ تلفح وجوههم النار ﴾ إنها لفحتهم لفحة واحدة فما أبقت لحما على عظم إلا ألقته عند أعقابهم
Indeed, some of the scholars have said concerning His saying, "The Fire [an-nār] will scorch their faces [wujūhahum]," that it scorches them a single scorching [lafḥatan], and it leaves no flesh upon bone except that it casts it down at their heels [aʿqābihim].

a.g: [It will be said]. "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"
They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.
Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."
He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.
Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."
[Allah] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"
They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."
He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.
Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"
So exalted is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.
And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
And, [O Muhammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."
